title: Ticket #5: Add CLA field to User table
description: The Users table should have a field for CLA status
remarks:
2009-Jan-13 16:28:13 by adesmet:
That would be the "Has this person signed a Condor Contributor License Agreement" field.

Of course, should someone who hasn't signed a CCLA be allowed access to gittrac at all?

2009-Jan-16 14:52:31 by matt:
That's the CLA - it is only important for deciding who we can take code from

2009-Feb-02 16:39:37 by psilord:
So, this is very simple to do, but should we use an entire column just for this information? We only have 5 user defined columns, and 4 are taken already.

2009-Feb-02 17:42:37 by tannenba:
I believe Matt was thinking we'd add a column to the user database, not the ticket database.

I don't think we need to do either.

Let's just use the already-existing "i" authorization flag on user accounts to signify if the user has signed the CLA or not. Recall that "i" means: 

   	 i	Check-in: Add new code to the GIT repository

Seems perfect. No changes needed, we can be ready to go now. Thoughts?

2009-Feb-02 21:40:13 by matt:
Sounds like a plan, can we make it clear somehow that it's CLA related, right now it's just a loose connection.

2009-Jun-09 17:59:21 by matt:
To close this user.c should be edited to mention the "Check-in" bit also refers to users who have signed the CLA.

2009-Jun-22 14:24:27 by tannenba:
Done, resolving.
